name: BBCWorld
text:
One in every eight deaths in Europe can be linked to pollution

A report by the EU's environment agency says air and noise pollution, as well as poor water quality and exposure to chemicals contribute to 13% of all deaths in the continent

[Thread]

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd

name: BBCWorld
text:
"Strong action is needed to protect the most vulnerable‚Äù

The EEA report found poorer communities and vulnerable people were hardest hit by pollution

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd https://t.co/I6EaqbcCk0

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Copenhagen-based agency‚Äôs report found 630,000 premature deaths in the EU were attributable to environmental factors in 2012 

(2012 is the latest year for which data is available)

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd https://t.co/cjUJKgnjq8

name: BBCWorld
text:
- Air pollution contributed to 400,000 of these annual deaths
- Noise pollution was an attributable factor in 12,000
- The remaining deaths were linked to extreme weather such as heatwaves

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd https://t.co/yNcX0MSTI5

name: BBCWorld
text:
The World Health Organization (WHO) says air pollution causes the death of millions of people around the world each year 

The WHO says air pollution accounts for a third of fatalities from stroke, lung cancer and heart disease

https://t.co/Eh0zvtz0rD https://t.co/4cBZEE6smf

name: BBCWorld
text:
"Poorer people are disproportionately exposed to air pollution and extreme weather, including heatwaves and extreme cold" the EEA says

The report also noted "clear differences" between Eastern and Western Europe

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd https://t.co/ptuBqEbtkO

name: BBCWorld
text:
The highest environmental contribution to mortality in the EU is seen in Romania at 19%

Other hard-hit countries include Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia

Around 12% of deaths in the UK are said to be linked to environmental pollution

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd https://t.co/O1ibLubwqH

name: BBCWorld
text:
Scientists suggest road traffic should be reduced to help tackle the issue

They want ‚Äúgreen and blue spaces" to be prioritised as they "cool cities during heatwaves, alleviate flood waters, reduce noise pollution and support urban biodiversity"

https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd https://t.co/SrP2756rpT

name: BBCWorld
text: Read more about the report, and how scientists hope to tackle the pollution problem: https://t.co/Eh0zvtQBQd
